article.title: Notes on fine structures of Chauliops with descriptions of two new species from China (Insecta: Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Malcidae)
article.abstract: The fine structures of Chauliops were studied using scanning electron microscope (SEM) techniques, and its taxonomic significance was discussed. Two new species of Chauliops Scott, Chauliops quaternaria sp. nov., from China (Yunnan province), and Chauliops conica sp. nov., from China (Shaanxi province), were described. A key to the known species of Chauliops Scott from China was given. The type specimens of the new species are deposited in the Institute of Entomology, Life Sciences College of Nankai University, Tianjin, China.

indexing.subject: Chauliopinae; Chauliops; new species; fine structure; China

article.title: Neotype designation and redescription of adult male and immature stages of Anopheles (Nyssorhynchus) pictipennis (Philippi) (Diptera: Culicidae)
article.abstract: A neotype is designated for Anopheles (Nyssorhynchus) pictipennis (Philippi) and morphological redescriptions are provided for the adult male, male genitalia, fourth-instar larva and pupa. All specimens, including the neotype were collected in Río Mapocho, Santiago, Chile in 1945 / 1946, and were deposited in the Entomological Collection of Faculdade de Saúde Pública, Universidade de São Paulo (FSP-USP), Brazil. The neotype was previously invalidly designated the allotype of An. pictipennis by Lane and Neghme (1946). Illustrations are provided for diagnostic characteristics of the male genitalia, and larval stage.

article.title: A new species of Psammisotoma Greenslade and Deharveng (Collembola: Isotomidae) from Brazil
article.abstract: A new species Psammisotoma restingae, from Maricá city, State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil is described and illustrated. The new species is similar to P. kingae Greenslade and Deharveng, 1996, but differs in the outer labial process, tergal sensillary pattern and claw.

article.title: Asiorrhina, a new Oriental genus of Lygistorrhinidae (Diptera: Sciaroidea) and its phylogenetic position
article.abstract: A new genus of Lygistorrhinidae, Asiorrhina gen. n., and a new species, Asiorrhina parasiatica sp. n., are described. Asiorrhina asiatica (Senior-White) comb. n. is redescribed and selected as the type species for the new genus. The systematic position of the new genus is discussed. All recent taxa of Lygistorrhinidae form a monophyletic group with the fossil genus Palaeognoriste Meunier as the sister group.

indexing.subject: taxonomy; new taxa; phylogeny; Lygistorrhina asiatica; Oriental region

article.title: Description of the immatures of the predaceous midge Bezzia blantoni Spinelli & Wirth (Diptera: Ceratopogonidae)
article.abstract: The fourth instar larva and pupa of Bezzia blantoni Spinelli & Wirth (1989) are described, illustrated and photomicrographed by using phase-contrast microscopy and Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM). The larva, which shows features typical to carnivorous larvae, is compared with that of B. roldani Spinelli & Wirth. The species is recorded for the first time from the Martín García island, located in the La Plata river between Argentina and Uruguay. Details of the biology traits, breeding location and feeding behavior are given.

indexing.subject: Larva; Pupa; Bezzia blantoni; SEM; Martín García island; Argentina

article.title: New records of Orthotylinae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Miridae) from the Palaearctic Region
article.abstract: The following 22 species of Orthotylinae are recorded for the first time from various Palaearctic countries: Blepharidopterus diaphanus (Mongolia), Dryophilocoris luteus (Serbia), Excentricus planicornis (Mongolia), Globiceps flavomaculatus (Mongolia), Globiceps sordidus albipennis (Northern Kazakhstan), Malacocoris chlorizans (Georgia and Kyrgyzstan), Mecomma ambulans (Latvia and Mongolia), Orthotylus eleagni (Kyrgyzstan), Orthotylus flavosparsus (Mongolia and Turkmenistan), Orthotylus lenensis (Mongolia), Orthotylus nassatus (Armenia, Kyrgyzstan, and Uzbekistan), Orthotylus viridinervis (southern parts of European Russia and Ukraine), Platycranus eckerleini (Morocco), Anapus kirschbaumi (Mongolia and Uzbekistan), Chorosomella jakowleffi (southern parts of European Russia), Euryopicoris nitidus (Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, and Mongolia), Halticus apterus (Mongolia), Halticus obscurior (Uzbekistan), Halticus puncticollis (West Siberia), Labops sahlbergii (European and Asian parts of Kazakhstan), Platyporus dorsalis (Azerbaijan), and Strongylocoris leucocephalus (Mongolia).

indexing.subject: Palaearctic Region; new records; Orthotylini; Halticini; taxonomy

article.title: Description of a new species of Tabanidae (Diptera) from the Amazon region: Catachlorops (Rhamphidommia) dubius sp. nov. and a key to species of the subgenus
article.abstract: We describe Catachlorops (Rhamphidommia) dubius sp. nov. from Amazon region Brazil. Figures and a dichotomous key of all species of Rhamphidommia are provided.

indexing.subject: Horse flies; Diachlorini; new species; Neotropical region; taxonomy
